title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (National Endowment for the Arts)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (National Endowment for the Arts)
communications.communication:
Dear National Endowment for the Arts,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to National Endowment for the Arts's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: NEA FOIA Request No. F25-032 | Final Response
communications.communication:
Dear Sai:

Thank you for your interest in the National Endowment for the Arts.

This email responds to your request for records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. §552, file number F25-032.

You requested the following:


  *   “1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
  *   2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
  *   3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
  *   4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.”

With respect to items 1, 2, and 3 above, attached are the responsive documents in response to your FOIA request with minimal redactions.  Sensitive personal data have been redacted in accordance with exemption (b)(6), which protects against “a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy,” 5 U.S.C. § 552(b)(6).  The Agency has considered the foreseeable harm standard in reviewing records and applying FOIA exemptions.

With respect to item 4 above, we kindly direct your attention to the agency’s FOIA Reports and Logs, containing information regarding FOIA personnel (in particular section IX): Agency FOIA Reports and Logs | National Endowment for the Arts<https://www.arts.gov/about/foia/agency-foia-reports-and-logs>, as well as a list of agency FOIA staff available at FOIA Contacts | National Endowment for the Arts<https://www.arts.gov/about/foia/foia-contacts>.

The National Endowment for the Arts is governed by the provisions of the National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities Act, 20 U.S.C. §951 et seq., and the Freedom of Information Act with respect to the release of agency records. In accordance with the NEA's FOIA regulations, 45 CFR §1148.8, you may appeal the Agency’s determination. Such an appeal must be made to the Chair of the National Endowment for the Arts within ninety days after the date of this e-mail. Additional information about the appeal process can be found at FOIA| NEA<https://www.arts.gov/about/freedom-of-information-act-foia-guide>.

If you would like to discuss our response before filing an appeal in an attempt to resolve your dispute, you can contact our FOIA Public Liaison<https://www.arts.gov/foia/foia-contacts> at FOIA@arts.gov<mailto:FOIA@arts.gov> for assistance. If we are unable to resolve your FOIA dispute through our FOIA Public Liaison, the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS), the Federal FOIA Ombudsman office, offers mediation services to help resolve disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies. The contact information for OGIS is:

Office of Government Information Services
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS
College Park, MD 20740-6001
ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>

Respectfully,
FOIA Office | Office of the General Counsel
National Endowment for the Arts
400 7th Street SW | Washington DC 20506
(202) 682-5418 (Office)
(202) 682-5572 (Fax)

[NEA Logo]
[cid:image002.png@01DB3F59.391FB4A0]<https://www.facebook.com/NationalEndowmentfortheArts>[cid:image003.png@01DB3F59.391FB4A0]<https://twitter.com/neaarts>[cid:image004.png@01DB3F59.391FB4A0]<https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/art-works-podcast/id1058911829>

Copies of all complaints to the Federal Trade Commission regarding Hasbro, the toy company (https://shop.hasbro.com/en-us). I request such records between Jan. 1, 2019 to present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Energy Regulatory Commission)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Energy Regulatory Commission)
communications.communication:
Dear Federal Energy Regulatory Commission,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Federal Energy Regulatory Commission's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Slammer Worm - FBI
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Investigative records on the 2003 slammer worm which broke out and began attacking Microsoft SQL servers. These records would likely exist between the dates of January 2002 and January 2006.
Please also include any records which may be responsive to internal impact from this worm and how it may have been remediated on FBI systems.

Please also see the attached news story which goes into some detail on the event.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emily Crose

    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?url_auth_token=AAAj2ProGzquHYFeb-SMkiAXsEc%3A1iKzrA%3ADZ3ROdQqmRpo7E8kvkifI7e3gkM&next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fslammer-worm-fbi-81815%252F%253Femail%253Dfoipaquestions%252540ic.fbi.gov

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1449881-000
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 138 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 571 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,289 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,649 days for processing.

Respectfully,


Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
F: (540) 868-4391
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Agency Roster (Kissimmee Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: SNL Complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All complaints received regarding Saturday Night Live on NBC from September 28, 2024 to the present day.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jed Rosenzweig

communications.subject: EOUSA-2019-003239
communications.communication:
Taylor Amarel 
MuckRock News, DEPT MR 74970 
411A Highland Ave 
Somerville, MA, 
02144EOUSA-2019-003239 
 
The Executive Office for United States Attorneys (EOUSA) has received your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA)/Privacy Act request. Your request has been assigned tracking number 02144EOUSA-2019-003239.  Please use this number in all future correspondence. 
Your request seeks records from one or more field offices, involves many voluminous records, or requires consultation with another agency or component with a substantial interest in the subject-matter and therefore falls within “unusual circumstances” as set forth in the statue. See 5 U.S.C.S § 552(a)(6)(B)(i)-(iii).  Accordingly, we are extending the time limit to respond to our request for ten additional days. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B))(i).  In addition, this Office assigns incoming requests to one of three tracks: simple, complex, or expedited.  Each request is then handled on a first-in, first-out basis in relation to other requests in the same track.  Simple requests usually receive a response in approximately 30 business days, whereas complex requests necessarily take longer.  At this time, your request has been assigned to the complex track. 
Under FOIA and Department of Justice regulations you may be required to pay certain costs associated with processing your request, including, searching for, reviewing, and duplicating requested records.  Consequently, you may potentially incur those costs, unless you have requested and been granted a waiver or reduction in fees.  In most instances, the first 100 pages to duplicate and the first two hours to search for records responsive to your request, will be provided to you free of charge.  If after making those allowances, we determine that the cost to process your request will amount to more than $25.00, we will notify you in writing at a later date. [1]  Requests that are specific, concrete and of limited scope (in time and/or subject matter) generally enable us to respond to you more quickly and possibly assess less fees.  To avoid delay and reduce any potential fees, we suggest you might wish to modify and narrow the scope of your request (See attachment). (#_ftn1) 
You may contact our FOIA Public Liaison at the telephone number listed above for any further assistance and to discuss any aspect of your request. Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation service they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 96012 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; email at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. (mailto:ogis@nara.gov) 
Attachment 
Form No. 001 - 8/16 THIS IS NOT A BILL.  DO NOT SEND MONEY 
*************    EOUSA-201*-00**** CHOOSE ONE 
____I wish to modify my request in an attempt to obtain a quicker response and/or reduce fees as follows: 
______________________________________________________________________________ 
______________________________________________________________________________ 
______________________________________________________________________________ 
______________________________________________________________________________ 
______________________________________________________________________________ 
 
____ I understand that I am entitled to the first 100 pages and two hours of search time for free.  Please do not search beyond two hours, nor duplicate beyond 100 pages. 
____I agree to pay up to the following amount for duplication and search time: $_____________ I understand that this payment is required even if no documents are located or released to me.  In the event that documents are located and released to me, I understand that I may be charged duplication fees in addition to search fees. 
____I wish to withdraw my request. 
_____________________________                                                  __________________ 
Signature                                                                                             Date 
 
Please return to: 
EOUSA 
FOIA/PA 
600 E Street, N.W., Room 7300 
Washington, DC 20530 
 [1] Search and review fees by professional personnel are charged at $40 per hour and duplication fees are assessed at five cents per page (#_ftnref1)

communications.subject: Your City of Ankeny public records request #24-795 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
City of Ankeny ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-795 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for submitting your request to the City of Ankeny. A review will be conducted to determine what, if any, records exist that match your criteria. According to the Iowa Code Section 22.8 (d), the City has a maximum of 20 days but ordinarily will not exceed 10 business days to complete the records request.  Should you determine that you forgot to include information in your request, you may edit the original request. There is no need to create a new request. The due date for your request may be later than usual because the office is closed on: * November 28: Thanksgiving * November 29: Thanksgiving As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the City of Ankeny portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the City of Ankeny through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Ankeny.

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Information Request: Cobwebs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

CONTRACTS and AGREEMENTS
• All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with Cobwebs America that were active any time between 1/1/2023 and 9/7/2024.

FINANCIAL MATERIALS
• All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to Cobwebs America. Responsive materials include all invoices, bills, receipts, check stubs, or any other records, including those possessed in an electronic format. Responsive materials include any records related to the funding of Cobwebs America- related technologies, partnerships, and subscriptions, including those related to civil asset forfeiture funds, grants, and any other funding sources.

MARKETING and PROMOTION MATERIALS
• All promotional, descriptive, and marketing materials in the possession of this agency related to and/or referencing “Cobwebs America" and any of its products and services. This includes all presentations, marketing materials, technical documentation, proposals, or similar records shared with this agency and/or any representative thereof by Cobwebs America.

GUIDING DOCUMENTATION and POLICIES
• All policies, memorandums of understanding, and other guidance materials generated by this agency and/or entity operating on its behalf regarding the acquisition and use of any data or services provided by Cobwebs America and any representative thereof or any subdivision thereof. Responsive materials include, but are not limited to, any data-sharing agreements, terms of use, licensing agreements, data retention policies, and any other guiding materials, such as user manuals, other guidance materials, help documents, or related materials.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Open Records Request :: W059795-090824
communications.communication:
Dear e e, 
We have received your Open Records Request and it has been given the reference number W059795-090824 for tracking purposes. 
The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. The request must ask for records or information already in existence. The governmental body will try to complete the request as soon as possible with notification if the request will require more than 10 business days to complete, not including weekends or holiday closures. The governmental body may collect a fee as prescribed by law or regulation for the requested documents. If a fee is not prescribed by law or regulation, the fee shall be the actual cost of duplicating the record(s). 
You can monitor the progress of this issue by clicking HERE and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Open Records Center. 
Sincerely, 
The City of Killeen

I wanted to follow up on the following Colorado Open Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Oct. 3, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

The agency reached out directly to MuckRock staff to confirm that you do mean to request these records from Englewood, Colorado, and to  (rather than another Englewood), and to ask you to clarify the scope of your request. 

I think it would be helpful if you could clarify the records you are requesting. 

For example, it sounds like you are asking for every email between the city attorney and police chief -- that may yield quite a few records which will need to be reviewed for confidential information and which are likely to be irrelevant to abandon vehicle policies. It also appears that you're asking for training materials as a subset of hearing records, which I'm not sure makes sense. 

Can you clarify the specific records that you're asking the agency to provide?

communications.communication: This request is directed towards Englewood Police Department in Englewood, Colorado.

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Tow Appeal Hearings
communications.communication:
I'd also like to request the recordings for the scheduled hearings from March 2020 to October 3rd 2023.


 11-1A-8: - Conduct of Hearing.

A.

The Hearing Officer shall conduct the hearing in an informal manner and shall not be bound by technical rules of evidence. Such hearing shall be tape recorded.

B.

The City shall carry the burden of establishing that there was probable cause to impound the vehicle in question.

C.

The Hearing Officer shall only determine that, as to the vehicle in question, the person requesting the hearing is the registered owner or other individual having right to possession, and either (1) there was probable cause to impound the vehicle, or (2) there was no such probable cause.

D.

At the conclusion of the hearing, the Hearing Officer shall prepare a written decision. A copy of such decision shall be provided to the individual requesting the hearing and the City. In the event that the Hearing Officer determines that there was no such probable cause, the Hearing Officer shall prepare a "certificate of no probable cause", copies of which shall be given to the owner of the vehicle, the City, and the garage storing the vehicle. Upon receipt of the owner's copy of such certificate, the police garage having custody of the vehicle shall release the vehicle to its owner.

E.

Upon a finding of no probable cause, towing and storage fees shall be paid by the City in accordance with arrangements made between the City and police garages.

F.

If the owner fails to present such certificate to the police garage having custody of the vehicle within twenty-four (24) hours of its receipt, excluding such days when the garage is not open for business, the owner shall assume liability for all subsequent storage charges. Such certificate shall inform the owner of such requirement.

G.

If the Hearing Officer determines that the impoundment was valid and if the owner does not comply with the appropriate ordinances within ten (10) days of the Hearing Officer's decision and refuses to remove the motor vehicle by means other under its own power on a public highway, the City OF Englewood shall have reasonable grounds to believe the motor vehicle has been abandoned and the provisions of Section 11-1A-4 of this Article shall apply and the vehicle may be disposed of in accordance with the provisions of said Section 11-1A-4, Disposition of Unclaimed Vehicles.

H.

The Hearing Officer's decision in no way affects any criminal proceeding in connection with the impound in question, and any criminal charges involved in such proceeding may only be challenged in the appropriate court.

I.

The decision of the Hearing Officer is final.

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Tow Appeal Hearings
communications.communication:
Requesting the records designating the Police Chief as the Hearing Officer overseeing hearings for vehicles towed by the police department.

11-1A-7: - Referral to Hearing Officer.

A.

The Hearing Officer shall be designated by the City Manager.

B.

Upon receipt by the City of a written request for a hearing, such hearing shall be conducted by the Hearing Officer within forty-eight (48) hours, excluding weekends and City holidays, unless such person requesting the hearing waives the right to a speedy hearing.

C.

The sole issues before the Hearing Officer shall be (1) whether there was probable cause to impound the vehicle in question. "Probable cause to impound" shall mean such a state of facts as would lead a person of ordinary care and prudence to believe that there was sufficient breach of local, State or Federal law to grant legal authority for the removal of the vehicle; (2) the person requesting the hearing is the registered owner or other individual having right to possession of the vehicle.

Thank you for your assistance and prompt attention to this matter.

communications.communication:
Thank you for your response. I would like to clarify that under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), there is no statutory requirement for formalities in submitting a request. As such, my original request remains valid and should not have been closed without legal justification.

Additionally, please provide a detailed breakdown of any anticipated costs as required. I also remind you that under CORA, records related to requests must be maintained for at least two years. I kindly ask for the specific statute or legal basis you are relying on to justify the closure of my request, as this action does not appear to be supported by the CORA Act.

Please consider this communication as a continuation of my initial request, and I expect your office to proceed with it in accordance with the law.

title: Robert Robideau (Department of Justice, United States Marshals)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Robert Robideau (Department of Justice, United States Marshals)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents and files, including letters, memos, emails and all communications pertaining to former American Indian Movement activist Robert "Bob" Robideau (born November 11, 1946 – died February 17, 2009). An obituary of whom was published in the Oregonian on February 9, 2009. A copy of his obituary is attached to this request as a PDF, and it may also be found at https://www.oregonlive.com/portland/2009/02/robert_robideau_native_america.html

I would also like to request a search of all available cross-index files for mentions of Robert Robideau in other documents, to be included with this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Estes

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2024-USMS-FOIA/PA-000253
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

Thank you for your continued support on this request. It appears that your agency has combined the following requests, so emails are coming into this email when they should be received at the appropriate email:

167971-67607796@requests.muckrock.com (according to your portal: 2024-USMS-FOIA/PA-000251)
167958-97827086@requests.muckrock.com (according to your portal: 2024-USMS-FOIA/PA-000252)
167964-46778753@requests.muckrock.com (according to your portal: 2024-USMS-FOIA/PA-000253/according to your acknowledgment email: FOIPA 1499255-001)

On your portal, all of these requests are listed together under the same requester; however, they should not all be under the same portal login as each respective request has its own unique email assigned to it and each should have their own respective login credentials. Separating each request in this way allows for easier tracking and less confusion, especially in cases like this one. 

As a result of this, I would like to confirm the information I have so far regarding these requests:


2024-USMS-FOIA/PA-000253 is stated to be Closed
2024-USMS-FOIA/PA-000252 is stated to be Closed
2024-USMS-FOIA/PA-000251 has been assigned to processing

Please confirm this information and use the following email address for 2024-USMS-FOIA/PA-000251: 167971-67607796@requests.muckrock.com.

Thank You

communications.subject: Re: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2024-USMS-FOIA/PA-000253
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS). This is an auto reply message.

As the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) ombudsman, OGIS assists FOIA requesters and federal agencies by helping them resolve their FOIA disputes, and by addressing their questions and concerns about the FOIA process. Please note, we are experiencing an increase in our inquiries received and are working to respond as soon as possible. We apologize for any delays in our response and assure you that all emails are tracked. We look forward to assisting you.

If you seek OGIS’s assistance with a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) dispute and have not done so already, please email us:
- A brief description of your dispute
- A copy of your FOIA request
- The agency’s response to your request
- Your appeal letter (if you filed an appeal)
- The agency's response to your appeal (if you received a response)  

We encourage you to transmit documents as PDF attachments via email, rather than through postal mail, which may cause delays in our response.

Sincerely,
The OGIS Staff

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristen Axtman

Allegheny County

communications.subject: Open Records Center Update :: W018901-110424
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
11/12/2024 
Kristen Axtman MuckRock News, DEPT MR175683 
263 Huntington Ave Boston, MA 02115 RE: Public Information Request Received 11/4/2024 Reference Number: #W018901-110424 Dear Kristen Axtman: 
This is in response to your request for records made pursuant the Pennsylvania Right-to-Know Law (RTKL).   Your request, which this Office received on 11/4/2024, is for the following records: 

A log of all Right to Know requests made about the “Allegheny County Jail” in fiscal year 2023. 
Please be advised that the County is invoking its right under Section 902 of the RTKL for an extension of time to complete a review of your request and to issue a final response for the following reason: 
Section 902 (a) (3) – A timely response to the request for access cannot be accomplished due to bona fide and specified staffing limitations.  Limited staff requires the need for additional time. 
By law, the Allegheny County Open Records Office has 30 days to issue a final response regarding this request.  A response is expected to be provided within 30 days of this date of this letter. Sincerely, /s/ Jessica Garofolo Allegheny County Open Records Officer

title: FOIA request for recent data on stops

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA request for recent data on stops
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to the most recent data on stops gathered for Community Policing Data. Specifically, I am seeking records for all stops conducted in Virginia, including the following details:

Agency name
Incident Record ID
Date and time of the stop
Stop location
Whether use of force was used

I am seeking this data at the individual stop level for all available records, up to and including November 2024. While I understand some data is published on the open data portal, this request is intended to obtain the most recent data not yet published.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Taeho Kim.

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Railroad Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Railroad Administration)
communications.communication:
Dear Federal Railroad Administration,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Federal Railroad Administration's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Railroad Administration)
communications.communication:
Dear Sia,

The FOIA requires that requesters describe the records sought with sufficient detail to allow an agency employee familiar with the subject area of the request to locate the records with a reasonable amount of effort.

Your request does not adequately describe the records sought; therefore, we are unable to process your request at this time.

It is unclear what date(s) of the records you are requesting. Please be specific and indicate the specific date and or subject if known.  Please provide the requested information to this office no later than close of business (20 working days from date of the request).  If we do not hear from you by this time, we will presume that you are no longer interested in pursuing your request, and we will close your request in this office.

Kind regards,

Yolanda Brown
GIS/RCC 20
Office of General Law
FRA FOIA

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Railroad Administration)
communications.communication:
Dear FRA,

My name is Sai, not Sia.

My request was perfectly clear. I am not required to provide a specific date or subject of the emails I requested. For each of the three requests, there is exactly one email that fits its description, and it is completely unambiguous. Moreover, there is no basis in law for you to "presume" that I am no longer interested in my request, or to close it for lack of response from me; case law clearly requires you to fulfill it with your best efforts.

If you intend to refuse my request on either basis, please say so explicitly, so that I may immediately appeal your denial.

Sincerely,
Sai

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Federal Railroad Administration)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Billing Records 2024 Colorado
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The billing records for all permitees on BLM grazing lands in Colorado for the year 2024. 

I am a reporter for High Country News.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

title: Cape Cod CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Cape Cod CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hello,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I am hereby submitting a Public Records Request for all money given from Cape Cod Community College to external vendors/suppliers in FY2015 through (and including) FY2024, a total of 10 years.

Specifically, the data I am requesting include (but are not limited to):
* all vendors, suppliers, individuals, and public-private partnerships
* all materials, goods, services, properties, commodities, equipment leases, property leases, and licenses
* all catalog orders, non-catalog orders, blanket orders, direct payments, bank card purchases, strategic sourcing, and competitive procurements
* all auxiliary services purchases (starts in 2022, may be from a different accounting system)
* all purchase orders, requisitions, and invoices
* all products, goods, services, contracts, and subcontracts
* all accounts, classes, commodities, and departments
* regardless of the funding source

I’m requesting the data in a single Excel spreadsheet file (.xlsx format) with at least the following columns:
* Amount
* Supplier/Vendor Name
* Account Description
* Commodity Description
* Fiscal Year
* Department/Origin Description

Please report every expense, even if one or more of the above fields is blank. Please also include negative expense amounts, which is rare but does occur.

In case it’s helpful, I've attached an image example of what I’m hoping to receive. The columns may be in any order, and the fiscal years may be on one sheet or different sheets. The columns can be sorted in any order, or unsorted if that’s easiest.

I’m anticipating that this request may be fulfilled by a simple financial report generation and export of the generated file, and therefore shouldn’t take much human time or incur any fees. Please let me know immediately if this isn’t the case, so I can modify my request as necessary to meet the PRL deadline of 10 business days.

Please email the Excel file by the deadline of Monday August 26th, 2024.

Thank you very much!

Sincerely,

AJ Vincelli
Graduate Student Union at UMass Dartmouth

files.title: FOIA_Request_Example.jpg
files.source: AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Cape Cod CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

The College is in receipt of your request. Given the scope of this request, there will be a fee associated with fulfillment. If more than 4 hours of employee time is required to search for, compile, segregate, redact or reproduce the records requested, a fee may be charged at an hourly rate equal to or less than the hourly rate attributed to the lowest paid employee who has the necessary skill required to complete the record request, which rate shall not exceed twenty-five dollars ($25) per hour.

We will begin the process of calculating this fee. Please note that payment of the fee will be required prior to the completion of the request. If the actual costs are less than the estimated fee, a refund will be issued. If the actual costs are greater than the estimated fee, a revised fee estimate will be issued.

Regards,
Patrick Stone


Patrick Stone
Director of Strategic Communications and Marketing
Cape Cod Community College
774-330-4714
pstone@capecod.edu<mailto:pstone@capecod.edu>

communications.communication:
Hi Patrick,

Thank you for this info. Unfortunately I'm not seeing some critical vendor expenses, such as to Epicurean for dining services. Sometimes these types of expenses are found in a secondary auxiliary reporting system, and aren't included in the standard reports.

Can you please include vendor expenses paid to Epicurean, as well as any other similar types of vendor expenses that were missing from the first spreadsheet?

Thanks very much,

AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Cape Cod CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hi,

Confirmed with our AP team that the file you received should have more than 500 lines related to Epicurean Feast included.
-Patrick

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Cape Cod CC Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hi Patrick,

Aha, I see those Epicurean transactions now! I must have misspelled the name. Sorry about that! I think I'm all set.

Thanks very much,

AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502
(505) 476 6133
(505) 827-8030 fax

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

files.title: image002
files.source: New Mexico Educational Retirement Board, New Mexico

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

MuckRock Staff

Renee

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Worcester State Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hello,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I am hereby submitting a Public Records Request for all money given from Worcester State University to external vendors/suppliers in FY2015 through (and including) FY2024, a total of 10 years.

Specifically, the data I am requesting include (but are not limited to):
* all vendors, suppliers, individuals, and public-private partnerships
* all materials, goods, services, properties, commodities, equipment leases, property leases, and licenses
* all catalog orders, non-catalog orders, blanket orders, direct payments, bank card purchases, strategic sourcing, and competitive procurements
* all auxiliary services purchases (starts in 2022, may be from a different accounting system)
* all purchase orders, requisitions, and invoices
* all products, goods, services, contracts, and subcontracts
* all accounts, classes, commodities, and departments
* regardless of the funding source

I’m requesting the data in a single Excel spreadsheet file (.xlsx format) with at least the following columns:
* Amount
* Supplier/Vendor Name
* Account Description
* Commodity Description
* Fiscal Year
* Department/Origin Description

Please report every expense, even if one or more of the above fields is blank. Please also include negative expense amounts, which is rare but does occur.

In case it’s helpful, I've attached an image example of what I’m hoping to receive. The columns may be in any order, and the fiscal years may be on one sheet or different sheets. The columns can be sorted in any order, or unsorted if that’s easiest.

I’m anticipating that this request may be fulfilled by a simple financial report generation and export of the generated file, and therefore shouldn’t take much human time or incur any fees. Please let me know immediately if this isn’t the case, so I can modify my request as necessary to meet the PRL deadline of 10 business days.

Please email the Excel file by the deadline of Monday August 26th, 2024.

Thank you very much!

Sincerely,

AJ Vincelli
Graduate Student Union at UMass Dartmouth

files.title: FOIA_Request_Example.jpg
files.source: AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Worcester State Vendor Expenses, FY15-FY24
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for providing this report. Unfortunately, I don't see all of the data here. For instance, I believe that Worcester State pays Compass Group (Chartwells) several million dollars per year for dining services, but these vendor payments aren't listed in the spreadsheet. Sometimes these types of expenses are located in a separate auxiliary services account, and are missing from the standard reports.

Can you please include the Compass Group vendor data, and any other similar missing vendors?

Thanks very much,

AJ Vincelli

communications.subject: Delaware Freedom of Information Act Request: Delaware Pay-to-Stay Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Delaware Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For each fiscal year from FY2019 through FY2023:
1. The operating budget for the Delaware Department of Corrections
2. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration, that were charged or assessed on inmates
3. The total amount of medical fees, including medical co-pays, that were charged or assessed on inmates
4. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration, that were paid by inmates and collected by the Delaware Department of Corrections
5. The total amount of medical fees, including medical co-pays, that were paid by inmates and collected by the Delaware Department of Corrections
6. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration, that were unpaid and turned into outstanding balance or debt.
7. The total amount of outstanding medical fees, including medical co-pays, that were unpaid and turned into outstanding balance or debt.
8. The total number of incarcerated adults who were charged room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration.
9. The total number of incarcerated adults who were charged medical fees, including medical co-pays.
10. The total number of incarcerated adults who participated in work-release or occupational/employment programs.
11. The hourly rate of the work-release or occupational/employment programs operating under the department’s jurisdiction.
12. The total amount of income earned by incarcerated adults employed in work-release or occupational/employment programs.
13. The amount and percentage of the income from work release or occupational/employment programs that was used to cover the costs of inmates’ incarceration or care.
14. Any policies and procedures relating to the imposition, collection, and enforcement of fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration or care.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Rudenberg, a citizen of Delaware, in coordination with Kelly Stevenson.

	 Jonathan Rudenberg

communications.subject: FW: FOIA Request from Jonathan Rudenberg
communications.communication:
Mr. Rudenberg;

In regards to your recent DE DOC FOIA request for DOC Operating budget each fiscal year 2019 – 2023 to include fees associated with cost of inmate’s incarceration, medical fees charged to inmates that were both paid and unpaid balances; total number of incarcerated adults who were charged fees, number of incarcerated adults participating in work release or occupational programs and hourly rate of pay, percentage of wage income used to cover costs of inmates incarceration or care.

At this time your DE DOC FOIA request is considered as an out of State request from Massachusetts and will be denied.

29 Del. C. §10001. Declaration of Policy.
It is vital in a democratic society that public business be performed in an open and public manner so that our citizens shall have the opportunity to observe the performance of public officials and to monitor the decisions that are made by such officials in formulating and executing public policy; and further, it is vital that citizens have easy access to public records in order that the society remain free and democratic. Toward these ends, and to further the accountability of government to the citizens of this State, this chapter is adopted, and shall be construed.

Please provide a Delaware address and resubmit your request.

Tim Martin
DE DOC
245 McKee Rd
Dover, DE 19904

communications.subject: FW: FOIA Request from Jonathan Rudenberg
communications.communication:
Mr. Rudenberg;

In regards to your recent DE DOC FOIA request for FY2029 – FY2023 DOC operating budget, room/board fees, medical co-pay fees and hourly rate of income for work release offenders.
Be advised that the 14 enumerated requests are below with DOC responses in Red. Also see attached Policies and exhibits A – D as responsive documents to your request.

For each fiscal year from FY2019 through FY2023:

1. The operating budget for the Delaware Department of Corrections – See Exhibit A
2. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration, that were charged or assessed on inmates – See Exhibit B (Charges)
3. The total amount of medical fees, including medical co-pays, that were charged or assessed on inmates– See Exhibit B (Charges)
4. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration, that were paid by inmates and collected by the Delaware Department of Corrections– See Exhibit B (Payments)
5. The total amount of medical fees, including medical co-pays, that were paid by inmates and collected by the Delaware Department of Corrections– See Exhibit B (Payments)
6. The total amount of room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration, that were unpaid and turned into outstanding balance or debt. – See Exhibit B (Closing Balance)
7. The total amount of outstanding medical fees, including medical co-pays, that were unpaid and turned into outstanding balance or debt. - See Exhibit B (Closing Balance)
8. The total number of incarcerated adults who were charged room & board fees, or fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration. The Delaware Department of Correction is unable to provide this level of information from an existing report.  Exhibit B is the available summary data.
9. The total number of incarcerated adults who were charged medical fees, including medical co-pays. The Delaware Department of Correction is unable to provide this level of information from an existing report.  Exhibit B is the available summary data.
10. The total number of incarcerated adults who participated in work-release or occupational/employment programs. See Exhibit C (# of Records Submitted)
11. The hourly rate of the work-release or occupational/employment programs operating under the department’s jurisdiction. See Exhibit D
12. The total amount of income earned by incarcerated adults employed in work-release or occupational/employment programs. See Exhibit C ($ Amount Submitted)
13. The amount and percentage of the income from work release or occupational/employment programs that was used to cover the costs of inmates’ incarceration or care. This level of detail is not tracked therefore the Delaware Department of Correction is unable to provide the requested data. In addition, inmates may receive funds from outside sources deposited to their inmate account.
14. Any policies and procedures relating to the imposition, collection, and enforcement of fees associated with the cost of an inmate’s incarceration or care. The Delaware Department of Correction Policies provided.

With this response your DE DOC FOIA request is considered as answered and will be closed.

Tim Martin
DE DOC
245 McKee Rd
Dover, DE 19904

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: FOIA Request for Case-Related Materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom this may concern,

I am writing to formally request access to public records under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Specifically, I am requesting any and all records and materials related to the case of 

Suspect Name: Michael Joseph Krupienski
Description/Headline: Husband charged with reckless homicide ‘after giving suicidal wife a gun to “call her bluff
Link of the Article: https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/crime/ohio-husband-charged-reckless-homicide-wife-suicide-b2621347.html 
State: Ohio
Law Enforcement: Vermilion Police Department

 included but not limited to the following:
Documents:
Incident reports
Investigation reports
Officer statements
Witness statements
Any other relevant case files

Footage:
Body camera footage from officers on the scene
Dash camera footage
Police surveillance camera footage
Private/public surveillance footage from nearby locations
Any footage collected as evidence or during the investigation

Audio:
911 calls
Police radio communications
Any other audio recordings related to the case
Visual Media:
Crime scene photographs
Surveillance stills
Photographs taken during the investigation

Court Records:
Transcripts from court hearings or proceedings
Any video/audio footage from court hearings
Court orders or any other court-related documents

Please include any and all materials, regardless of format (digital or physical), including those not listed above that are related to the case in question.
Additionally, if this request has been sent to the wrong department or agency, I would appreciate it if you could provide guidance or contact information for the correct department or agency that handles such requests.

If any part of the request is denied or redacted, please provide a detailed explanation of the specific legal exemption that applies.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response within the period mandated by FOIA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

david yupa

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Consumer Products Safety Commission)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (Consumer Products Safety Commission)
communications.communication:
Dear Consumer Products Safety Commission,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to Consumer Products Safety Commission's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

communications.subject: FOIA Request Acknowledgement by the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission's e-FOIA Public Access Link (PAL) Application
communications.communication:
Dear P. Sai, 
Thank you for submitting a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request with the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission.  We are in receipt of the request you submitted.  Your submission has been assigned to case/request number #25-F-00077.   Please reference the request number #25-F-00077 in all future correspondence with the Commission's FOIA staff. 
Due to certain procedural steps we are required to take under our statute, there may be delays in providing the records.  Please be assured that every effort is being made to process each request as equitably as possible, and that the records or information that you have requested will be made available to you at the earliest possible date. If you have any questions or need to contact us, we are available Monday – Friday from 8:00AM – 4:30PM EST by telephone on 800-638-2772, by fax on 301-504-0127, by e-mail addressed to cpsc-foia@cpsc.gov or by postal mail. (mailto:cpsc-foia@cpsc.gov?subject=Contact CPSC's FOIA Staff)
Regards, 
FOIA Staff 
U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Norris Cotton
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Norris Henry Cotton (May 11, 1900 - February 24, 1989), who served as Senator for New Hampshire from 1954 to 1974, and briefly in 1975 due to a highly contested election. Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.
